Katsune Donkatsu CafÃ© 

Jan 16, 2020

Katsune Donkatsu CafÃ© is a modest counter-serve cafÃ© setting decorated only by picnic-patterned tables. Katsu is a popular Japanese/Korean deep fried panko breaded meat cutlet served with â€œBull Dogâ€ tonkatsu sauce, a Japanese sauce sweetened with fruit and vegetables.

Katsune is one of the few Bergen County restaurants totally dedicated to katsu-style dishes, and theyâ€™ve mastered it. The restaurant has lengthier and flatter panko breadcrumbs that make their katsu flakier than all.

The cafÃ© serves up the standard pork donkatsu, as well as the famous cheese â€œCordon Bleuâ€ donkatsu (pork - pictured below), chicken, ebi (shrimp), beef and pork patty (menchi) katsu dishes. They also serve up a â€œWang Donkatsuâ€, a much larger, even crispier, pounded flat donkatsu. A side of made-in-house curry can be added to all dishes too.

Their cheese donkatsu comes with a generous stuffing of mozzarella cheese that makes for the picture-perfect cheese pull. Katsune also keeps their pork tenderloin so juicy after frying, something thatâ€™s difficult to accomplish in deep-fried meat dishes.

Pork Cordon Bleu (Cheese Donkatsu)

All dishes are served with a side of steamed white rice, corn, Japanese-style coleslaw, and soy sauce pickles. They are also accompanied by the standard â€œBull Dogâ€ tonkatsu sauce, as well as a homemade banana sauce thatâ€™s surprisingly addictive.

The unassuming exterior of the restaurant might not bring you in right away, but the flakiest katsu in Bergen County (maybe even in the NYC areaâ€¦) makes this a place youâ€™ll regret not eating at. Katsune Donkatsu for the win!
